title: Forklift Operator
description:
Description:

Join a growing company: Quantix, the premier provider of services, our purpose and our passions are simple be the success catalyst for everyone we touch.


Position Overview: The Forklift Operator is responsible for the handling process of the customer's packaged and pre-packaged product that is shipped, received, and stored at Quantix.


Requirements:

The Warehouse Forklift Operator ensures that all products and supplies are handled and stored safely and all required data accurately recorded into the VMU.


Essential Job Functions:General Operate Warehouse forklift in a safe manner at all times. Follow all work instructions. Accurately complete and forward all paperwork in a timely manner. Verifying that all customer packages are in good condition and reporting any non-conformance on a NCR form. Maintain housekeeping of Warehouse and Dock facilities. Assist in all warehouse operations as required Report findings of contaminates to management. Take product samples as required. Communicate all problems and issues to management. Input data accurately into VMU as required. Follow all safety procedures and all United DC's workplace policies.Safety Safety is a job requirement. Safety always comes first. Always work safely and follow all safety procedures. Always use required PPE properly. Responsible for reporting any incidents or injuries to management immediately. Responsible for reporting any known safety issues to management immediately.


Company Competencies A - Accountability: Learn from your mistakes, change habits to avoid repeating the same mistake C- Caring : Helping others reach excellence, step up when opportunities are presented C- Courage : Respond truthfully an honestly in difficult situations D - Dedication : Be the best version of yourself, complete tasks P- Problem Solvers : View problems as a an opportunity T - Teamwork: Work together to get the job done

**Qualifications**

* Must have 1 year of sit down propane forklift experience (certified forklift license preferred)
* Must have at least 6 consecutive months of experience driving a forklift daily
* Must pass drug test
* A valid state drivers license
* Lift up to 25 kilograms (55.1 pounds) for 15 minutes
* Lift and move pallets weighing up to 34 kilograms (75 pounds)
* This employer participates in e-verify \\* NO FELONY CONVICTIONS WITHIN THE LAST 7 YEARS \\* Must be able to Pass Background and Drug Screen

**Abilities required**


These physical demands are representative of the physical requirements necessary for an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodation can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential job functions.


While performing the responsibilities, the employee is required to talk and hear. The employee is often required to sit and use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel and to manipulate keys on a keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

**Disclaimer**


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.
company_description: Quantix is the leading supply chain services company to the chemical industry. We provide the world's largest chemical providers with end-to-end support.

title: Self Storage Relief Property Manager (Moove In Self Storage)
description:
Description:

($20 - $21 per hour)


This position will help to cover across all of our locations in Northern NJ, including Franklin, Hamburg, Newton, Ledgewood, and West Milford.

***The Role:***  

The Relief Property Manager is responsible for the daily operations of an assigned self-storage facility within the Moove In Self Storage portfolio of properties. You will follow the Property Manager’s direction for his or her facility while you are managing the property in his or her absence. All Property Managers represent our company in a professional manner with a positive attitude, willingness to help tenants and customers, with an eagerness to learn and do your best every day.

***The Business:***  

Moove In Self Storage (MISS) is a locally owned and operated storage portfolio with locations in Pennsylvania, Maryland, New York, New Jersey, Iowa, Connecticut, Massachusetts, Delaware, and Virginia. We are growing and expanding into new and existing markets. Learn more at *www.moovein.com*.

***The Environment:***


Moove In Self Storage employees are team-oriented where all colleagues wear many hats and help each other succeed. While business is the priority, colleagues are encouraged to live healthy, balanced lives. Our company is guided by the core values of doing the right thing for our clients, being engaged, enthusiastic and competitive, working hard and smart, having fun, and being compassionate and authentic.

***Specific Duties:***

* Interact daily with customers and present storage options to meet their needs.
* Communicate with customers via email, telephone and in person as outlined in the Operations Manual.
* Visually inspect the facility daily; address maintenance and cleanliness issues as needed.
* Make daily bank deposits and deliveries to the Post Office.
* Be responsible for accurate computer accounting records and petty cash funds.
* Timely collection of rent, deposits, assessed fees and other fees.
* Selling retail merchandise such as locks, packing materials and boxes.
* Make past due calls to delinquent accounts.
* May be required to work other facilities and events as needed.
* Be thoroughly familiar with emergency procedures such as dealing with fires, criminal activity, accidents, natural or “man-made” disasters.
* Participate in training programs or seminars at management’s request.
* Other duties as assigned.


Requirements:
***Qualifications:***

* Valid Driver’s License.
* 1-3 years of experience in a customer service or sales role.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Publisher, and Word.
* Property Management experience is a plus.

***Physical Requirements:***

* Must be able to traverse the location and inspect the entire property in varying weather conditions.
* Able to sit for long periods of time.
* Stooping, bending, twisting, reaching and repetitive motion may be required in the completion of job duties.
* Ability to travel to locations other than the facility for the purpose of completing company errands.
* Must be able to lift 25+ pounds.

title: Operational Risk Manager
description:
Description:
**About Bankwell:**


Bankwell is a commercial bank with more than $3 billion in assets that serves the banking needs of businesses and individuals. At Bankwell, we pride ourselves on our unique ability to bring you high touch, high quality banking with the expertise and dedication of our experienced team of professionals. When it comes to business, our deep industry knowledge, flexibility and innovative treasury and financing services enable us to find the right solutions for our business and commercial clients. We’re passionate about giving back and are actively involved with many not-for-profit organizations that help shape and improve the lives of others. We’re dedicated to giving our time and talent to support the communities we serve. More about Bankwell can be found at www.mybankwell.com.

**Summary of Position:**


The Operational Risk Manager is responsible for assisting the Director of Risk Management with conducting due diligence regarding onboarding new and review of existing third-party relationships and vendors. They will also be responsible for performing and assisting in the performance of reviews on all non-mission critical third party and vendor relationships. They will work with the respective business units on performing Operational Risk Assessments including but not limited to escalating any potential issues and assisting in the oversight of Model Risk Management.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Identifying and assessing operational risks across the organization, developing and maintaining a comprehensive risk register, conducting regular risk assessments and evaluations to determine the potential impact of identified risks
* Developing and implementing risk mitigation strategies and action plans, designing and implementing effective risk controls and measures to minimize operational risks, monitoring the effectiveness of risk controls and adjusting them as necessary
* Developing, updating and enforcing operational risk management policies and procedures, ensuring that policies and procedures comply with regulatory requirements and industry standards, communicating policies and procedures to relevant stakeholders and ensuring their understanding and adherence
* Monitoring operational risk indicators and key risk metrics, preparing and presenting regular risk reports to senior management and the board of directors, ensuring timely and accurate documentation and reporting of risk management activities
* Leading investigations into operational risk incidents and identifying root causes, developing and implementing corrective actions to prevent recurrence of incidents, maintaining an incident log and tracking the status of corrective actions
* Developing and delivering risk management training programs for employees, promoting a risk-aware culture within the organization through regular communication and awareness initiatives
* Evaluating and monitoring the risk associated with third-party vendors and service providers, developing and implementing vendor risk management policies and procedures, conducting due diligence and regular assessments of vendors to ensure compliance with organizational standards and regulatory requirements, collaborating with other departments to negotiate vendor contracts and manage vendor relationships, maintaining a vendor risk register and ensuring timely reporting and documentation of vendor-related risk
* Staying updated on regulatory changes and ensuring the organization’s operational risk management practices are compliant, assisting in regulatory audits and examinations as needed
* Working closely with other departments to ensure a comprehensive approach to risk management, collaborating with external auditors, regulators, and other stakeholders on risk-related matters, acting as a trusted advisor to senior management on operational risk issues
* Compiling and preparing materials for the oversight and governance of operational risk, including materials related to third party risk management and other risk areas as necessary to achieve the goals of the job


Requirements:
**Qualifications & Skills:**

* Minimum of 5-7 Years of experience in risk management, internal audit, or a related field
* Proven track record of managing operational risk in a corporate environment
* Bachelor’s degree in risk management, finance, business administration, or a related field is required
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to lead and influence others at all levels of the organization
* High level of integrity and ethical judgment
* Advanced degree (e.g., MBA, MS in Risk Management) is preferred
* Certifications such as: Certified Risk Management Professional (CRMP), Financial Risk Manager (FRM), Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC) preferred

title: Afterschool Counselor
description:
Description:
**YOUR ROLE**


As the **Afterschool Counselor** you will supervise students in our Extended Day program, which provides after school care for our preschool and elementary school students. This position collaborates with our Enrichment Coordinator to create and maintain programs which seamlessly compliment the children’s experience in their Montessori and IB classrooms. We are a close-knit team, and value initiative, flexibility, and a can- do approach.

**ABOUT US**


Green Ivy Schools is a future-facing network of innovative schools, education thought-leaders, partnerships, and programs that prioritize climate activism, community engagement, and ethical enthusiasm for emerging technology. We offer both Spanish and Mandarin immersion programs for students in grades pre-kinder through fifth grade.

**ABOUT YOU**

* **You love working with children:** You enjoy supporting student learning and are confident working with a mix age group of 3-11-year old children
* **You are a passionate about education:** You are excited to work in a Montessori model and continue to grow as an educator under the mentorship of the lead teacher and Enrichment Coordinator
* **You are a people person:** You are warm, courteous, and professional with children, families and caregivers
* **You love being part of a team:** You support your co-workers by being responsible, punctual, flexible and willing to help others as needed

**WHAT YOU WILL DO**

* Supervise and care of the children’s daily needs (including assistance with bathrooming for young children)
* Implement the daily schedule
* Prepare and organize classroom materials
* Engage with children in the After school Clubhouse (playing games, helping with homework, arts and crafts, etc.)
* Ensure the safety and wellbeing of all Clubhouse students at all times
* Supervise dismissal


Requirements:
* 1 year experience working with children ages 3-11 in a group setting (eg. classroom, camp, enrichment classes)
* Montessori classroom experience or training preferred but not required
* Must be fully vaccinated for Covid
* Must be authorized to work in the United States
* Preference will be given to candidates who can also serve as substitute teachers during the school day
company_description: Green Ivy International Schools are a future-facing network of innovative, multilingual schools offering the International Baccalaureate program for PK through 8th grade.

title: Associate, Corporate Development
description:
Who we are
  
  

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.
  
  

Get to know the business
  
  

Within Finance, AIG’s Corporate Development team is responsible for the evaluation and execution of strategic transactions, including acquisitions, divestitures, joint ventures and minority investments.
  
  

About the role
  
  

The Corporate Development team is seeking an Associate / Senior Associate to support the evaluation and execution of strategic transactions. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and quantitative skills and the ability to present complex information in a manner that supports executive decision-making. Additionally, the candidate must demonstrate excellent organizational and communications skills and the ability to deliver a high-quality work product in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  
  

Associates / Senior Associates play an integral role on the Corporate Development team and while day-to-day responsibilities are diverse, core responsibilities include the below:
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

Actively support all aspects of the M&A process
  
  

Prepare financial models to evaluate strategic transactions; develop valuation analyses based on discounted cash flows, comparable companies and precedent transactions; evaluate pro forma financial impacts under various scenarios
  
  

Draft memorandums and presentations for AIG’s senior management, Board of Directors and other key stakeholders
  
  

Execute and oversee due diligence processes including liaising with business units, enterprise functions (e.g., legal, tax, finance, etc.) and external advisors
  
  

Perform ad hoc financial analysis in support of other strategic initiatives
  
  

Support AIG's Integration and Separation Office in transitioning target businesses to future state model including tracking of post-signing deliverables and closing activities
  
  

Mentor and train junior resources. Support development of scalable processes and best practices for the Corporate Development function
  
  

Monitor financial and operational performance of insurance peers and develop and maintain a deep understanding of emerging trends and industry dynamics
  
  

What we’re looking for
  
  

A bachelor’s degree is required, with a major in finance or accounting preferred
  
  

2+ years of M&A experience (corporate development, investment banking or private equity) with experience executing all aspects of M&A transactions; P&C transaction experience a plus
  
  

Extensive understanding of the M&A process and proven track record executing M&A transactions across the entire deal lifecycle
  
  

Demonstrated analytical and quantitative abilities with experience performing financial and valuation analysis
  
  

Knowledge of the property and casualty insurance industry
  
  

Executive-level communication skills (written, verbal and interpersonal) with an ability to communicate to all audience levels
  
  

Organizational skills necessary to support / lead multiple projects under strict deadlines
  
  

Highly motivated, proactive, performance-driven and team-oriented
  
  

Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel and PowerPoint
  
  

Advanced proficiency with FactSet, S&P Capital IQ and/or Bloomberg
  
  

For positions based in NYC, the base salary range is $109,000 - $125,000. In addition, the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. We’re proud to offer a range of competitive benefits a summary of which can be viewed here: AIG Benefits Overview
  
  

#LI-CY1
  
  

Enjoy benefits that take care of what matters
  
  

At AIG, our people are our greatest asset. We know how important it is to protect and invest in what’s most important to you. That is why we created our Total Rewards Program, a comprehensive benefits package that extends beyond time spent at work to offer benefits focused on your health, wellbeing and financial security—as well as your professional development—to bring peace of mind to you and your family.
  
  

Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world
  
  

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.
  
  

Welcome to a culture of belonging
  
  

We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
  
  

AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.
  
  

AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com.
  
  

**Functional Area:**  

PA - Planning & Acquisitions
  
  

**Estimated Travel Percentage (%):** Up to 25%
  
  

**Relocation Provided:** No
  
  

AIG Employee Services, Inc.
company_description: AIG and its member companies form one of the world’s leading insurance organizations.

title: Registered Nurse
description:
Description:

We are the largest multi-specialty urology focused practice in the country. Our doctors and staff are committed to providing the highest level of quality medical services available. Join our team for a rewarding career with a growing health care organization who values our staff as much as we do our patients.

**\\*\\* Hours are Monday through Friday. No Weekends. No Nights, No Evenings. No Holidays. No Call. \\*\\***

 **Job Responsibilities**

* Provide bedside care to patients including personal hygiene maintenance
* Record the patients’ vital signs (including blood pressure, pulse, and respiratory rate)

* Relay information between patients, registered nurses, and physicians

* Patient Teaching/Counseling from the direction of physician

**Benefits**

* Comprehensive medical
* Dental
* Vision
* 401K
* Paid time off


Requirements:
**Minimum Requirements**  

* High School graduate or equivalent
* Current RN License
* Medical Terminology (preferred, but not necessary)
* BCLS/ACLS
* Annual Required in-services and training.
* Infection control certificate

title: Physical Therapy Assistant, PTA
company: EPIC Rehabilitation and Nursing at White Plains
description:
Description:
**\\* FULL -TIME \\* EXCELLENT BENEFITS \\* GREAT TEAM\\***

**Physical Therapist Assistant, PTA Position Summary:**

**EPIC Rehabilitation and Nursing at White Plains is a BEAUTIFUL \\*5 Star\\* 160-bed NEW skilled nursing & rehabilitation center opened in 2020 in the heart of White Plains.** Come join a family of facilities in New York State. Intrinsic to each facility in the EPIC portfolio are the words “Rehabilitation & Healthcare”, as our overriding goal is to rehabilitate patients and successfully return them to their lives. For those who have come to reside permanently, we aim to create the best possible environment while optimizing their quality of life.

* Physical Therapist Assistant, PTA is responsible to organize, and conduct physical therapy programs planned and overseen by the Physical Therapist to facilitate rehabilitation of those residents who have experienced a decrease in functions.
* Physical Therapist Assistant, PTA will assist in planning, organizing, developing and implementing Physical Therapy services under the supervision of the Physical Therapist, to ensure that the highest degree of quality resident care can be maintained at all times.
* Performs treatment programs for assigned residents
* Enter billing information in an accurate and timely manner
* Report resident progress in meetings, i.e. UR Meeting, Patient/Family Conference as deemed required or appropriate
* Consult with other members of the rehabilitation team to coordinate physical therapy with other therapeutic activities
* Provide residents with equipment as appropriate
* Chart notes in an informative and descriptive manner that reflects the therapy provided to the residents, as well as the resident’s response to the therapy
* Perform routine documentation as required and in accordance with our established charting and documentation policies and procedures. Sign and date all entries made in residents’ medical record.
* Cooperate with all departments and staff facilitating harmonious working conditions to promote optimal resident care


Requirements:
* Graduate of an accredited school of Physical Therapy Assistant, PTA
* Licensed in NY State as a Physical Therapist Assistant, PTA; license in good standing
* Previous skilled nursing facility (SNF) experience highly proffered
* Work well under pressure & willing to work harmoniously with all staff
* Sincere desire to work with the elderly, chronically ill, and handicapped
* Excellent customer service skills
* Must be able to communicate well verbally with residents, families and staff
* Treat residents and fellow staff with respect, dignity, and compassion
* Covid-19 vaccinations are encouraged but **NOT MANDATED**; we continue to offer COVID-19 vaccination based on eligibility guidance from CDC

**We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, celebrate diversity, & are committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all!** We comply with disability laws and provides reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees. For assistance with the application, interview process, job functions, or employment benefits, contact the facility directly by calling 914.350.9010 and asking to speak to the HR Department or email us at HR@epicwpr.com

* Benefit eligible on first day of employment.
* 401k with 100% employer match up to the first 3% you contribute & 50% of the next 2% of pay that you contribute
* Paid time off and holiday pay
* Parental leave benefits.

**What are a Courier’s Responsibilities?**

* Package and deliver radiopharmaceuticals, compliantly
* Process returns from customers
* Ensure timely delivery of the correct package to the customer
* Completes Department of Transportation (DOT) paperwork for deliveries
* Maintain cleanliness of delivery vehicles
* Other duties as assigned

**What Experiences and Education Do I Need to Bring To RLS?**

* Valid driver’s license
* Clean driving record
* Pass background check
* Pass drug screen
* Ability to accommodate shift changes and on-call scheduling
* Must be able to lift 25 to 50 lbs. routinely with an occasional 70 lbs.

**All About RLS:**


From our couriers on the road to our technicians and pharmacists in the labs, RLS empowers employees to act as owners, playing a critical role as true partners in our business. Led by a seasoned team of industry veterans, RLS is one of America’s highest-quality radiopharmaceutical providers, operating 29 radiopharmacies across 18 states. Our work together is key to providing critical diagnostics for doctors and hospitals nationwide, ensuring patients receive the life-enhancing and life-saving care they deserve.


At RLS, we take pride in fostering a unique workplace environment which combines a spirit of innovation, a tight-knit culture across all levels of the company, along with world-class support systems and processes. We emphasize growth opportunities for our team members and are proud of the fact that our people enjoy upwardly mobile career journeys here, including the chance to learn new skills and explore different areas of the business.


Consider joining our fast-growing team as we build a leading firm in the radiopharmacy industry.


For additional information, please visit our website: www.rls.bio.


RLS will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check and drug screen (as applicable). RLS offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. RLS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

title: Creative Operations Manager
description:
Description:
**About MKG**


Founded in 2003, MKG is a women-led creative agency specializing in brand action. Brand actions – including live experiences, digital, virtual, and hybrid events, employee engagements, and social impact actions – humanize brands through creative storytelling and thoughtful, purpose-driven engagement. We’re proud to be long-standing partners to brands like Google, Target, Netflix, Meta, HBO, Delta Air Lines, and Apple TV+ and have offices in NYC and LA.

**Working at MKG**


MKG, with offices in NYC and LA, is actively looking for an incredibly organized individual with a design or art background who has a knack for keeping projects on track. Candidates should be within commuting distance of either office and will need to be available for in-person collaboration on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Role will be located in the New York office.

**Overview of the Role**


MKG is looking for a talented and versatile, mid-level Creative Operations Manager to become a member of both our Creative and Operations teams. This role will report into the Executive Creative Director with a dotted line to the Resourcing Manager.


In this role, your focus will be ensuring smooth and streamlined resourcing and operations across our Creative Department. You will oversee utilization of all members of the team while assisting in managing and improving various creative processes that result in efficient workflows and high quality output. Additionally you will help foster a positive and collaborative environment that provides opportunities for both relationship building and individual growth across the team.

**What You Will Do In This Role**

* Oversee the day to day operations of the Creative Team, which includes Environmental Designers, Graphic Designers, Creative Strategists and Creative Directors
* Manage all Creative resourcing. Track, organize and prioritize all incoming requests for resourcing and provide timely staffing plans and solutions, including initial project staffing, coverage and support plans.
* Manage and track all Creative resource allocations and utilization. Constantly check in with individuals/teams to monitor their projects and update allocations to accurately reflect any changes, accounting for any scope or timeline changes.
* Identify when full time resources are not available and freelance support is needed. Work through the proper channels to obtain financial approval for bringing on external resources
* Manage and maintain an updated Freelance Roster grid—frequently checking in with our top partners for availability and noting it for reference.
* Constantly work with the ECD to identify talent or level gaps in our talent pool and actively search for additional freelancers to add to our roster
* Coordinate interviews (and join them) with potential new freelancers and the ECD (or other Senior Creative team members) to add into the freelance roster mix
* Manage freelance and full time onboarding to ensure successful training when new people join the team
* Monitor and track project process and create reports ECD and Resource Manager, raising flags when necessary and identifying trends for discussion
* Organize, roll out and manage creative process updates, ensuring adoption of more efficient workflows across the department and agency
* Assist ECD and Resource Manager in identifying process improvements that could better align with both Department and Agency goals. Put together action plans to make the changes necessary.
* Participate in the full time hiring process, helping to identify new talent to connect with or existing freelancers that want to convert to full time. Coordinate and join interviews as needed.
* Work with IT to assemble and manage a Creative Department equipment budget, including software subscriptions, hardware needs and equipment maintenance
* Build strong relationships with the Creative team through a strong in-office presence and frequent communication (especially with West coast and remote employees)
* Foster camaraderie, positive collaboration and growth among the Creative team by bringing enthusiasm to daily interactions, striving to relieve avoidable paint points and stressors and providing opportunities for individuals to be challenged and learn new skills.
* Assist in or spearhead planning Creative Team bonding events throughout the calendar year

**Salary Details**


$70,000 - $90,000 annually


\\*\\*\\*This is the minimum + maximum base salary that we, in good faith, are willing to pay at the time of the posting. Salary commensurate with experience


Requirements:
**What You Will Bring To This Role**

* 3-5 years of experience in creative-related resourcing, recruiting, project management, or other related work
* Stellar communication skills
* Extremely strong organizational skills
* Diligent follow through on all tasks
* Knowledge and understanding of creative/design processes and timelines
* Experience or interest in the event and experiential marketing industry
* Ability to manage multiple work streams simultaneously and stick to deadlines
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
* Experience using project management and/or resourcing tools
* Experience in Google Suite (not required but a plus)

title: Radiology Business Office Specialist- FT
description:
Description:
**Holmdel Imaging** is seeking a highly motivated, enthusiastic, compassionate individual who is a strong communicator to join an energetic, patient-focused team! Are you passionate about patient care? Do you love interacting with people? Come and join our team as a **Business Office Specialist I** for a **full-time** position at our outpatient imaging center located in **Holmdel, NJ**.

**PAY AND BENEFITS:** Accomplishing our mission takes a team of people, who are dedicated to treating others as they expect to be treated and who consistently demonstrate mutual respect. We hold our employees in high regard as the key component to our success. We offer a total compensation package including competitive base pay and a comprehensive benefits program for your health, your quality of life, and your future:

* Shift Differential Pay and Quarterly Bonus Program
* Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay
* Health Insurance including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage with an FSA Account
* 401(k) plan with Company Match and Company-paid Life Insurance
* Short-term and Long-term Disability and Employee Assistance Program
* Remote Work Opportunities for select roles!
* Entry level? We’ll train!
* Sign-on Bonus or Relocation Assistance available to qualified candidates for select positions

**CAREER LADDER:** We believe in advancement, upward mobility, and growth opportunities for our team members! This career ladder shows your point of entry into our team, as well as the growth and promotional opportunities available to you within our business office department: **Business Office Specialist I** - Business Office Specialist II - Business Office Specialist III - Business Office Supervisor - Business Office Manager


The Business Office Team is responsible for collaborating and leading the Imaging Center team in providing excellent patient care and supporting the operational goals for both the Center and the organization. This includes all customer and patient-facing responsibilities including welcoming, registering, and overall patient coordination, as well as phone correspondence, scheduling appointments, inventory, and medical record management. The upper levels of this series also include the training, supervision, and management of Business Office team members. The overall scope for this series is designed to ensure the management and resources are available to maintain a quality, high functioning, and customer friendly Outpatient Imaging Center.


Requirements:
**EDUCATION:**

* To be competitive, must have high school diploma or general education degree (GED).

**SKILLS/ABILITIES:**

* Ability to work independently and multitask.
* Ability to provide documentation accurately and concisely.
* Knowledge of medical terminology.
* Knowledge of computer applications and Microsoft Office


Holmdel Imaging offers a full range of diagnostic and screening radiology services. Our primary mission is to offer affordable medical imaging without compromising expertise or a compassionate experience. To learn more, visit us at www.holmdelimaging.com.


Serving patients in over 50+ communities, OIA is an imaging center management & development operation that is committed to delivering an affordable diagnostic imaging option without compromising customer convenience, care, technology, or results. We are always recruiting talented individuals who are dedicated to excellent patient care and the highest level of customer service. Visit http://www.oiarad.com/Careers/ today to view all our clinical and non-clinical career opportunities.


We review every resume and we’re actively interviewing! Apply today for immediate consideration!


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

**OIA Core Values: Respect – Integrity – Accountability – Commitment - Results**

title: Assistant Preschool Teacher (3K)
description:
Description:

NY Kids Club & NY Preschool is inspiring today’s children to succeed in tomorrow’s world with our love for play— and we’re looking for a **3K Assistant Preschool Teacher** to join our growing team!


Our mission is to instill a lifelong love of learning with our engaging curriculum, taught in a safe, dynamic and supportive environment and designed to enrich every child throughout their educational journey.


We pride ourselves on an environment that allows you to find a sense of belonging, learn from your diverse teammates, who have a great sense of humor, and take pride in everything they do; if that sounds like you, join us!

**Here’s what a 3K Assistant Teacher's day looks like:**

* Ensure each student's health and safety at all times through close supervision and adherence to our daily protocols
* Speak with parents and caregivers regarding student progress
* Assist in implementing our unique and original curriculum
* Maintain the highest level of customer service possible in accordance with the NY Kids Club pillars of service
* Have a high level of enthusiasm and professionalism, and a desire to bring joy to learning
* Work with Lead Preschool Teacher to assess student abilities and progress

*The statements in this job description are intended to describe the essential nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be all responsibilities or qualifications of the job.*


Requirements:
**This job is for you if you:**

* Have a High School Diploma or GED- required
* Have a Bachelor’s Degree in a related field preferred (Early Childhood Education, Elementary Education, or Special Education highly recommended) or are in pursuit of a Bachelor's Degree
* Have 1 year of teaching experience (ideally in a preschool classroom)
* Are a self-starter, highly motivated, dynamic, and a creative team player
* Have excellent communication skills
* Are a lifelong learner!

**What’s in it for you:**

**Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits** – As a valued team member, you will be eligible for NY Kids Club’s health, dental, and vision insurance plans through UnitedHealthcare.

**Paid Time Off** – NY Kids Club supports a healthy work/life balance. You will be eligible for up to 10 days of paid vacation, 2 Floating Holidays, and 56 hours of Safe/Sick Time per year.

**401(k) Savings and Retirement Plan** – NY Kids Club wants to support you long-term. You will be eligible to enroll in NY Kids Clubs’ 401(k) program. NY Kids Club provides a discretionary match of up to 3% of your investment per year.

**Tuition Assistance** – NY Kids Club has designed a tuition assistance program to support those working towards an early childhood (or related field) Bachelor's or Master's degree. You are eligible for tuition assistance of up to $2,000 per year.

**Commuter Program** – You will be eligible to participate in the WageWorks program, which allows for the pre-tax purchase of MetroCards or debit cards to purchase commuting tickets and passes from transit operators throughout the metropolitan area. Additionally, you will be eligible for a discounted membership through CitiBike.

**Stay Active** – NY Kids Club is committed to your health and wellness. Enjoy unlimited access to Crunch Fitness with discounted membership options.

**Enrich your Children** – We want to welcome your whole family! If you have children, you are gifted one complimentary 1.5 hours or two 45-minute classes per semester or a $500 non-transferable credit to be used towards any program or event.

**Employee Referral Program** – We encourage our team to refer their qualified family and friends to join the NY Kids Club community. For any referral who is hired and stays for a minimum of 90 days, you will receive a referral bonus of $500!

**Start Saving** – NY Kids Club offers you discounts on everyday experiences, entertainment offerings, phone plans, electronics, vacations, and even cars! These exclusive savings are FREE!

*The pay rate for this role is $36,000 per year*

**Physical Demands:**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that are to be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, and sit, engage in constant movement, and use hands and arms to feel and reach. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance and crawl, stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 30 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific sensory abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. The employee is also frequently required to taste and/or smell, and regularly required to talk and/or hear.

**At NY Kids Club & NY Preschool, we strive to be an inclusive and diverse community where all team members work in an accepting environment. We celebrate our differences and lead with kindness and respect. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, military or veteran status, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. These are our guiding principles that apply to all terms of employment, including promotions, transfers, leave of absence, compensation, and training.**

*The NY Kids Club complies with all requirements set forth by the Americans with Disabilities Act, City, State, and Federal law. If you require any accommodation in the completion of this application, please reach out to interview@nykidsclub.com.*
company_description: NY Kids Club is New York's premier children's enrichment center, renowned for creative and innovative kids' classes, preschool, day camps, birthday celebrations, and special events!

title: JJT CAR-T Manufacturing Site IT Manager
description:
Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine is recruiting a JJT CAR-T Manufacturing Site IT Manager role with responsibility for Supply Chain CAR-T manufacturing systems, based at our NA-Raritan, NJ Advanced Therapies site.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

  

Working within an impactful team (HPT) environment, this position will have main responsibility for supporting/advancing J&J IT systems capability related to Advanced and Cell Therapies manufacturing, operational and project activities and closely engaging with Supply Chain manufacturing site functions. Individual will work with Senior site IT/Business Management to identify and prioritize IT solutions and coordinate the consistent implementation of these solutions across the business. They will exhibit strong influencing skills and determination for driving the site towards consistent technology solutions aligned to an overall IT strategy. The JJT CAR-T Manufacturing Site IT Manager should have a strong view of external IT capabilities in the market and how they can be applied to drive business value for J&J.

  

We are looking for a strong leader that will be the primary IT partner for the Raritan Manufacturing operations team with responsibility for the plant technology product roadmap, portfolio, aligned to Business and JJT strategy for the Raritan CAR-T site. In addition, it has the responsibility to ensure that the IT products that support the manufacturing site are coordinated efficiently to deliver application roadmap strategies using Agile and Release Management. The Manufacturing Site IT Leader will own the operational IT budget for site JJT Operation Products and Solutions as well as have input and coordination on IT investment prioritization.

  

Key Responsibilities:


* Actively leads the CAR-T mfg. site IT systems ecosystem as a Site IT Manager with responsibility for local IT products and partnering with the site operations and business team to ensure adoption of technology capabilities.
* Lead / Support all related Project and Portfolio Implementations and related investments for the manufacturing site.
* Drive’s reliability of the IT product ecosystem through Technology Lifecycle Management programs and Cybersecurity mitigations
* Drives collaboration and execution with internal and external Partners
* Program and Service Manager: Tracks progress of product development and deployment using Agile Release Management
* Talent Leader: A leader and developer of talent; coach and mentor individuals to excel in product management.
* Passionately owns and role models diversity & inclusion.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



Education:


* A Bachelor’s Degree is required, preferably in Computer Science, Technology, Engineering, or related field.

  

Experience and Skills:



Required:


* Pharma Manufacturing/CAR-T IT Systems experience.
* At least 4 years of IT product (application) management, design, and solution in the deployment of major IT capabilities (like manufacturing/shop floor systems).
* At least 3 years of pharma supply chain/manufacturing IT operations experience in a regulated environment and knowledge and understanding of manufacturing processes and procedures.
* Must have 3 years of direct people management experience.
* Strong Business & Communication skills. Shown ability to work efficiently with business and technology partners to understand business requirements.
* Experience working in a Shared Services model where development and support services are provided by virtual, multi-location, multi-functional teams.
* Leadership experience in building teams with the above capabilities.

  

Preferred:


* Project delivery experience
* Experience running budgets and financials.

  

Other:


* Good interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.

  

The anticipated base pay range for this position is 99000 to 170200.



The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding the individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.


* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits: - Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year of Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

  

  

* Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits


The compensation and benefits information set forth in this posting applies to candidates hired in the United States. Candidates hired outside the United States will be eligible for compensation and benefits in accordance with their local market.

title: Associate Director, Global Associate Compound Market Access Leader, Hematology
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



Global Commercial Strategy Organization, a group within Janssen Global Services and a member of Johnson & Johnson's family of companies, is recruiting for a Global Compound Market Access Leader. This position will be based in Raritan, NJ.



The Associate Director, reporting to one of the Compound Market Access Leaders (CMAL), Hematology, has a key leadership role in developing and driving the market access strategy for the respective product/indication, aligned with the global brand strategy. In doing so, the Associate Director will shape key strategic decisions such as clinical development and integrated evidence generation.



The Associate Director takes a lead in development of brand value propositions and collaborates through the Compound and Extended Market Access Teams (CMAT / EMAT) to deliver timely, optimal reimbursement in a highly challenging environment across diverse regions with complex and differing needs. The Associate Director must understand the needs of markets and develop appropriate solutions.

  

Key Responsibilities:


* Support the Compound Market Access Leader (CMAL) for strategic planning and implementation of the payer value generation and access strategies for the product / indication in scope.
* Drive the design and management of health outcomes studies for the indication including: systematic literature reviews, real world evidence studies, and user-friendly cost effectiveness and budget impact models that can be adapted for coordinated delivery to key decision makers.
* Interact with Regional Market Access/Health Economics / Outcomes Research and Medical Affairs teams to coordinate and develop real world evidence generation in support of their access programs.
* Provide leadership to the indication specific clinical working group (CWG) in terms of market access data needs related to the clinical development plan.
* Act as part of cross-functional Global Indication Team with Global Commercial & Medical Affairs and ensure appropriate evidence is generated to develop robust differentiable value proposition for the indication at launch and during life cycle management.
* Foster collaboration, alignment and seamless working across R&D and GCSO functions, including the Clinical Development Team (CDT),Commercial, Medical Affairs, and Global Market Access COE to ensure optimal launch readiness for the brand.
* Take indication specific budgetary responsibility, ensuring that spending is managed effectively throughout the year and to plan.
* Keep up to date with scientific developments, bringing the latest techniques and analyses to build the strongest possible value proposition.
* Understand the patient perspective of the disease and recommend strategies that can support the patient voice in key payer negotiations.

  

Required Education & Experience:

  

* Master’s degree in appropriate field (Science, Economics, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Health Economics, or Public Health).
* A minimum of 6 years in Health Economics and Outcomes Research or Market Access.
* This position is based in Raritan, NJ and may require up to 30% domestic and/or international travel.

  

Required Skills:

  

Market Access Landscape: The ability to shape the evolving payer landscape by researching, developing, and maintaining a deep understanding of payers and their perspectives in the key global markets. This includes knowledge of trends in pricing, reimbursement, healthcare policy, and all market archetypes.



Health Technology Assessment: Knowledge of the principles of evidence-based medicine and methodologies to evaluate health-related technology and deliver product dossiers.



Market Access Analytics: The ability to systematically gather and analyze information from various sources, including modeling, pricing, and contracting strategies. This includes the ability to generate data to support real-world evidence, identify and communicate patterns and trends, and evaluate and develop strategic plans.



Evidence Generation: The ability to apply data science concepts and methodologies to identify and articulate value propositions, create and implement value strategies, generate business insights, and drive evidence generation and debate on the appropriateness of conclusions. This includes providing market access inputs to clinical trial design, implementation, and analyses and knowledge of meta-analysis as well as epidemiologic studies.

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



Preferred Experience:


* Prior oncology experience
* Demonstrated leadership experience in successfully working across functional and geographic boundaries, preferably across multiple countries/market types/access models


Preferred Skills:


* Therapeutic Area Knowledge: Knowledge of relevant therapeutic areas and targeted disease states to provide market access inputs into clinical trial design. This includes knowledge of portfolios, products, services, treatment options, associated clinical outcomes, understanding of patient flow, and the broader impact these variables have on market access strategies.
* Clinical Trial Methodology: Knowledge of clinical trials and trial design. This includes applying knowledge to recommend study design plan and methodology, considering trade-offs of different approaches, and developing hypotheses to test primary versus secondary endpoints and implications for labeling.
* Leadership Without Authority: The ability to utilize a deep understanding of internal and external stakeholder needs and perspectives to build collaborative partnerships, advocate for the value of market access strategies, and influence stakeholder decision making without authority. This includes taking ownership and being accountable to deliver key outcomes by engaging others and enabling alignment and discussion to ensure the right conclusions are captured.


Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.



The anticipated base pay range for this position is: $135,000-$232,300.


* The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results


by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.


* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
* Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
* Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year


For additional general information on company benefits please go to: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits



For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com .

title: Associate Sales Representative (New York City, NY) NeuWave Medical
description:
NeuWave Medical, a division of Ethicon, LLC and a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for an Associate Sales Representative for New York, NY.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

  

For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges.

  

We know that the success of our business – and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions – depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued and our people can reach their potential.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we all belong.

  

The Associate Sales Representative (ASR) position provides clinical and selling support in hospital and procedures, while ensuring customer service for existing and new customers, sales logistics, technical expertise, asset management, and product knowledge.

  

The ASR is responsible for supporting NeuWave sales growth initiatives and maintaining/managing physician and account relationships within their geographical region. The ASR will identify physician sales opportunities in NeuWave accounts, uncover stakeholder goals and deliver NeuWave training pathway to targeted customers. R egularly the ASR will serve as a technical consultant to physicians in the procedure room, during live cases

  

This position requires extensive travel within the Region with the possibility of weekend work and/or overnight travel. Majority of time will be spent in hospital setting and physician offices and includes sales related activity and coverage of cases in interventional radiology (IR) and operating room (OR).

  

As an ASR, you will be aligned to support customers by working with and under the guidance of the local sales team (Territory Managers and Account Managers). Following successful completion of the ASR role, promotion to Sales Representative may include an additional relocation within the US.

  

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $55,000-$85,000 annually.

  

This position is eligible for a company car through the Company’s FLEET program.

  

* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s long-term incentive program.
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
* Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
* Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year


Additional information can be found through the link below.



For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to: - https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



QUALIFICATIONS



REQUIRED


* A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university/college is required
* The ability to work in a lab/operating room environment is required
* A valid driver's license issued in the United States is required
* The ability to travel which may include weekend and/or overnight travel
* Ability to travel up to 50% – 80%
* This position requires travel and relocation with uncertainty of final territory responsibility.
* Strong interpersonal communication, negotiation, influencing, strategic thinking, problem solving, and business acumen skills required
* Experienced in data analysis and have excellent problem-solving skills required
* Results orientation/sense of urgency – ability to drive to tight timelines required
* Internal and external customer focus required
* Ability to work independently and autonomously required
* Ability to work in matrix and team structure required
* High level of attention to detail required
* Demonstrated ability to understand, interpret, communicate and work in complex environment required


PREFERED


* 2 years of relevant sales or professional experience is preferred
* Documentation of successful sales performance is preferred.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional, and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.

  

For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.

  

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Lead, Technical Product Analyst ERM Data & Analytics
description:
Johnson & Johnson Technology is currently recruiting for Lead, Technical Product Analyst ERM Data & Analytics primarily located in Raritan, NJ.



At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges. We know that the success of our business – and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions – depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued and our people can reach their potential.



At Johnson & Johnson, we all belong.



The Enterprise Risk Management(ERM) Product Line is uniquely positioned to power Data and Analytics technologies that enable end-to-end risk management, operational/advanced analytics and data science capabilities for Johnson & Johnson. In close partnership with JJT organization and our business, we will develop, leverage and scale smarter, faster and more efficient future-ready enterprise platforms and capabilities that will help to unlock new insights needed to drive innovation, commercial growth, operational efficiencies and improved health outcomes.



This position will have specific responsibilities as a Product Analyst with strong technical skills, delivering the high impact Enterprise Risk Management program that address the evolving needs of our risk functions. The Product Analyst will be responsible for coordinating the requirement elicitation, design, and documentation of these Risk Data solutions. This includes business requirements gathering, process gap analysis, process improvement, user story generation, scope management, and issue resolution.



Responsibilities:


* Partner with Technology Product Owner (TPO) and Business Product Owners (BPO) to understand business drivers and to deliver Analytics products that address business needs.
* Shape and lead Data & Analytics capabilities for Enterprise Risk Management based upon business drivers and IT strategies.
* Communicate product vision and functional requirements to product development team.
* Participate in the development and evolution of product strategy and roadmap by staying current in technology advancements and working closely with architecture teams and IT management.
* Lead and deliver features that enhance the solution, drive and measure usage and improve performance.
* Utilize Agile methodology to work with business partners to define and translate business needs into user stories, prioritize product backlog, and define sprint plans.
* Cultivate collaborative, healthy, inclusive, and credo-based culture of highly engaged, high performing teams by modeling credo values and valuing diverse perspectives.
* Writes, leads clarifies requirements, and may develop use cases for sophisticated requirements
* Build detailed business requirements and/or user stories, use cases, and user acceptance test criteria
* Assists in the planning and development of system testing procedures
* Assists in testing and may assist unit testers so that definition of done for requirements are satisfied
* Engagement with agile team (using Agile methodologies) with other J&J Technology functions and roles (e.g. Solutions Lead, TPO, Technology Services, ISRM, etc.).
* Write user stories and prioritize product development backlog. (Acceptance criteria used BDD Executable Scenario Syntax)
* Ultimately responsible for day-to-day operational aspects, participate in agile ceremonies and backlog grooming, requirements and user story definition and manage product backlog health.
* Understand business model and process mapping techniques to identify critical key IT capabilities.
* Acting as the primary trusted advisor to BPO and TPO to align on product development needs for specific products and platforms.
* Collaborate with multiple teams and technology disciplines. Ensures that Business SMEs, Developers, Testers and SQA work as a single unit and are aligned. Engages regional SMEs and other partners as and when needed.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



Required:


* A minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required, preferably in technology or engineering discipline.
* 5+ years in strong business analysis and product requirements gathering skills
* Experience in SDLC practices & Agile delivery
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Proven track record of building strong business partner relationships
* Must possess the ability to work independently and be self-accountable for flawless execution.


Preferred:


* Experience IT space specializing in Data Management, Analytics and Insights generation
* Ability to assemble, analyze, and evaluate data and to be able to make appropriate and well-reasoned recommendations and decisions to the Business stakeholders and the Project Team
* Build and optimize data pipelines for extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using Integration technologies to meet business requirements.
* Perform root cause analysis on external and internal processes / source systems and data to identify opportunities for improvement
* Excellent analytic skills associated with working on unstructured datasets
* Build processes that support data integrations, workload management, dependency and job orchestration
* Hands on experience in writing SQL queries
* AWS Associate Developer / Architect certification
* Knowledge on Python, Pyspark
* Experience with modern BI visualization technologies such as Tableau, Power BI
* Experience working with Data warehouses, Data Lakes, Data lakehouses
* Knowledge of Databricks, AWS Azure
* Practical experience using Agile development methodology
* Experience delivering Enterprise Risk Products/Analytics
* Experience collaborating cross-functionally within a matrixed IT organization
* Demonstrated track record of delivering successful data and analytics products and solutions
* Must be a self-motivated problem solver who thrives in a dynamic and customer-focused environment.
* Strong analytical thinking, problem solving and learning agility skills
* Ability to succeed in a matrixed environment and influence adoption of new thinking
* The ability to work with minimal supervision and achieve results in a fast-paced environment

  

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $90,000 to $144.900.



The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis. · Please use the following language:


* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
* Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year of Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year
* Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits


The compensation and benefits information set forth in this posting applies to candidates hired in the United States. Candidates hired outside the United States will be eligible for compensation and benefits in accordance with their local market.



Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.



For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.
